task.title: Deploying Maestro VM in VMware vCloud

context.p: This procedure provides instructions on how to deploy the Maestro VM in VMware vCloud. For more information, see VMware documentation.

step.cmd: Update the OVF file to match with your VMware vCloud network as follows:
Log in to vCloud Director (VCD) by entering the URL of your organization in the browser, for example, https://cloud.example.com/cloud/org/myOrg.
In the VCD do the following:

li.p: Click the My Cloud tab, then click the vApps tab and then click the Add vApp from OVF tab.
Select the source from which to upload the OVF file and click Next.
Click Browse, navigate to the OVF file and click Next
Name the vApp and add optional description if needed.
From the drop-down menu, select a virtual data center on which to store and run the vApp and click Next.
From the drop-down menu, select a storage policy for the vApp's VMs and click Next.
For each VM, from the drop-down menu, select the network for the VM and click Next.
Review the hardware settings for the VMs in the vApp and click Next
Review the configuration of the vApp and click Finish.

step.cmd: Verify that the Maestro VM is deployed successfully and the IP address is assigned. If the IP address is not displayed, perform the procedure .
